item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed NHS staff may not have to isolate
item.description: Health leaders urge the government to change quarantine rules to avoid severe staff shortages.

item.title: Covid to get worse before it gets better, doctors warn
item.description: Medical leaders urge people to act with care including continuing to wear face masks in indoor areas.

item.title: Chris Eubank's son Sebastian dies in Dubai
item.description: The former British boxer says his son was "loved and respected by all who knew him".

item.title: Colchester parents 'ecstatic' after baby approved for £1.7m drug
item.description: Ten-month-old Edward will receive the world's most expensive drug after a campaign by his parents.

item.title: Jovenel Moïse: Haiti requests foreign troops after president's assassination
item.description: Haitian officials want US and UN forces to protect key infrastructure in the country in turmoil.

item.title: Heart inflammation link to Pfizer and Moderna jabs
item.description: But European regulators say the benefits of Covid vaccines continue to far outweigh the risks.

item.title: Tamim Ian Habimana: Boy, 15, charged with murder in Woolwich
item.description: Tamim Ian Habimana died shortly after he was found with a single stab wound in Woolwich town centre.

item.title: NI ministers fail in legal bid for bonfire removal
item.description: The bonfire is in the unionist Tiger's Bay area, close to an interface with the nationalist New Lodge.

item.title: Paul Mariner: Former Ipswich and England striker dies aged 68
item.description: Former England striker Paul Mariner, who won the FA Cup and Uefa Cup with Ipswich Town, dies at the age of 68.

item.title: Grizzly bear shot dead after killing woman in Montana
item.description: Leah Davis Lokan, 65, was on a mountain biking trip when she was attacked by the bear.

item.title: Mystery North Norfolk treasure 'could be sword-related'
item.description: Experts say they don't know what the early Anglo-Saxon object is, but it could be part of a sword.

item.title: The Papers: 'Let's bring it home!' and 'one game from glory'
item.description: Saturday's papers look ahead to Sunday's Euro 2020 final between England and Italy.

item.title: Covid-19: Isolation changes for NHS staff, and a hunt for the pandemic's origin
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… England’s Covid gamble
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at the UK government’s plan to lift Covid restrictions in England.

item.title: The schoolkids who said they saw 'aliens'
item.description: In 1994, 60 children at a Zimbabwe school said they'd seen a "UFO" - a BBC crew was first on the scene.

item.title: Quadriplegic driver makes Goodwood Festival racing debut
item.description: Former IndyCar driver Sam Schmidt was paralysed from the shoulders down in a racing accident in 2000.

item.title: Week in pictures: 3 - 9 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Team GB swimmers 'trolled for our small bums and boobs'
item.description: Olympic hopefuls Izzy Thorpe and Kate Shortman say they've dealt with body-shaming since school.

item.title: Harleen Deol makes stunning catch in England v India
item.description: Watch as Harleen Deol takes a stunning juggling catch on the boundary to dismiss England's Amy Jones.

item.title: Are lots of people deleting the NHS Covid app?
item.description: Are people using the government's Covid app or are they deleting it?

item.title: Fire lookouts: The US Forest Service lookouts watching for fires
item.description: In remote towers, US Forest Service lookouts act as an early warning system for forest fires.

item.title: Why strawberry experts are hoping to serve up an Ace
item.description: How a new variety of championship berry may help farmers survive Brexit and the pandemic.

item.title: Covid origins: Scientists weigh up evidence over virus's origins
item.description: Researchers aim to "set the record straight" on how the virus transferred from bats into humans.

item.title: Bristol musicians challenging gender norms
item.description: Mandi went through their transition from male to female while working as a DJ in Bristol.

item.title: Photographs reveal people behind rare illnesses
item.description: A photographer wants to show the beauty of the people touched by rare and debilitating conditions.

item.title: Covid: Can the arts lead the green recovery from the pandemic?
item.description: The pandemic has devastated the arts, but green shoots of recovery may be forming - in every sense.

item.title: Haiti president's assassination: What we know so far
item.description: Armed men stormed the private residence of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse and shot him dead.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Ashleigh Barty faces Karolina Pliskova in women's final
item.description: Ashleigh Barty says she "couldn't be more rapt" to play her first SW19 final on the 50th anniversary of her idol Evonne Goolagong Cawley's maiden win.

item.title: Nuno Tavares: Arsenal sign left-back from Benfica in £8m deal
item.description: Arsenal sign Benfica left-back Nuno Tavares in a deal worth about £8m.

item.title: England batsman Pope sidelined by thigh injury
item.description: England batsman Ollie Pope is out until the start of the Test series against India in August with a thigh injury.

item.title: Euro 2020: Jewels remain... Get Grealish... England fan-speak explained
item.description: Why is football coming home? Who was Jules Rimet? And what's a penalty shootout? Read on...

item.title: Euro 2020: 'Out of despair, Italy have brought joy to a nation'
item.description: Italy are a team transformed under Roberto Mancini and they approach Sunday's Euro 2020 final having captured the hearts of a nation.

item.title: England fans on diversity in the Three Lions squad
item.description: Ahead of Sunday's Euros final, England fans speak about diversity and representation in the Three Lions.

item.title: Eight rounds, 104 answers - bumper Euros final quiz
item.description: Eight rounds, 104 possible answers - take on our quiz and test your knowledge before the Euro 2020 final.

item.title: Euro 2020: My dream finish to England's story - Alan Shearer
item.description: Former England captain and BBC Sport columnist Alan Shearer says Gareth Southgate and his side are on the verge of greatness after an amazing month, and reveals his dream finish to Euro 2020.

item.title: Gareth Southgate: The England manager - by those who know him best
item.description: As Gareth Southgate prepares for the European Championship final, those who know him best reveal the real England manager.

item.title: England v Italy Euro 2020 final: No egos allowed makes this England camp different - Rio Ferdinand
item.description: Former England defender Rio Ferdinand says squad depth and the culture Gareth Southgate has created in the camp means he always believed they would go the distance at Euro 2020.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The contact tracing app could be changed to make it less sensitive, so it sends fewer alerts.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch the final?
item.description: Wembley will host 60,000 fans at the final, but millions will be watching on TV at home and in pubs.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and will they go ahead despite Covid?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics are due to start in July, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 45 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.
